name: AI-Powered RWA Management
description: Comprehensive evaluation template for AI applications in Real World Assets tokenization, valuation, and management
author: Shai Perednik

categories.name: Asset Tokenization
categories.description: Evaluation of AI in asset tokenization process and valuation models

metrics.name: Valuation Accuracy
metrics.description: Accuracy of AI-driven asset valuation models and methodologies

thresholds.T0: Advanced AI valuation models with <5% error margin; multi-model ensemble approach combining multiple ML techniques; real-time market data integration; automated consideration of macro-economic indicators; adaptation to niche asset classes; explainable valuation logic; continuous learning from actual transaction data
thresholds.T1: Basic AI valuation models with <15% error margin; standard ML-based approach; reasonable market data integration; manual adjustment of major economic factors; conventional valuation methods with ML enhancements

metrics.name: Tokenization Efficiency
metrics.description: Efficiency of AI-driven tokenization process and smart contract generation

thresholds.T0: Highly automated tokenization pipeline with AI-optimized smart contract generation; dynamic fractional ownership models; automated regulatory compliance checks; intelligent asset classification; optimal token economic design; gas-efficient contract generation; cross-chain compatibility by default
thresholds.T1: Semi-automated tokenization process with standard smart contract templates; basic fractional models; manual compliance checks with AI assistance; conventional token economics; single-chain focus

metrics.name: Asset Verification
metrics.description: Quality of AI-powered asset verification and authentication systems

thresholds.T0: Advanced multi-modal AI verification combining computer vision, document analysis, and data verification; IoT integration for physical asset monitoring; forgery detection >99% accuracy; blockchain-based verification history; automated red flag detection; third-party data source integration
thresholds.T1: Basic AI verification systems with document analysis and standard checks; reasonable forgery detection (>90% accuracy); manual verification of complex cases; basic data source integration

categories.name: Market Liquidity
categories.description: Evaluation of AI in managing RWA market liquidity and trading infrastructure

metrics.name: Liquidity Prediction
metrics.description: Accuracy of AI liquidity prediction models for RWA markets

thresholds.T0: Advanced AI liquidity forecasting with >90% accuracy; real-time liquidity risk alerts; predictive market depth modeling; trading volume projection; seasonal pattern recognition; multi-timeframe analysis; liquidity crisis early warning system; correlation analysis with traditional markets
thresholds.T1: Basic AI liquidity forecasting with >70% accuracy; standard liquidity monitoring; simple trading volume analysis; conventional risk metrics with some ML enhancement

metrics.name: Market Making
metrics.description: Effectiveness of AI-powered market making and liquidity provision

thresholds.T0: Sophisticated AI market making algorithms; dynamic spread adjustment based on market conditions; multi-venue liquidity provision; inventory optimization models; adverse selection prevention; market impact minimization; reinforcement learning for strategy adaptation; cross-asset market making
thresholds.T1: Basic AI-enhanced market making; standard spread management; single-venue focus; conventional inventory management with ML optimization; reasonable market impact consideration

metrics.name: Price Stability
metrics.description: Effectiveness of AI in maintaining price stability for tokenized assets

thresholds.T0: Advanced AI price stabilization mechanisms; automated liquidity pool rebalancing; volatility prediction and mitigation; deep order book maintenance; circuit breaker systems with ML-optimized parameters; arbitrage opportunity elimination; flash crash prevention; correlation-aware stability mechanisms
thresholds.T1: Basic AI-enhanced price stability tools; standard liquidity pool management; simple volatility monitoring; conventional circuit breakers; reasonable arbitrage limitation

categories.name: Compliance Monitoring
categories.description: Evaluation of AI in RWA compliance and regulatory monitoring

metrics.name: Regulatory Compliance
metrics.description: Quality of AI-driven regulatory compliance monitoring and adaptation

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive AI compliance system covering multiple jurisdictions; real-time regulatory change detection with NLP; automated impact assessment for new regulations; dynamic compliance rule engine; jurisdiction-specific requirement handling; proactive compliance optimization; audit-ready documentation generation
thresholds.T1: Basic AI-enhanced compliance monitoring; standard regulatory tracking; manual impact assessment with AI assistance; conventional rule-based compliance with ML enhancements

metrics.name: Asset Tracking
metrics.description: Effectiveness of AI-powered asset tracking and monitoring systems

thresholds.T0: Advanced multi-sensor IoT integration with AI analytics; real-time physical asset monitoring; predictive maintenance and condition assessment; anomaly detection for asset misuse; geospatial tracking with privacy protections; immutable chain-of-custody; digital twin integration with blockchain records
thresholds.T1: Basic IoT-enabled asset tracking; standard monitoring capabilities; periodic condition assessment; simple anomaly detection; conventional chain-of-custody with blockchain anchoring

metrics.name: Reporting Automation
metrics.description: Quality of AI-automated reporting and disclosure systems

thresholds.T0: Fully automated reporting with natural language generation; customizable reporting dashboards; multi-jurisdictional report generation; real-time disclosure capabilities; integrated audit trails; data visualization automation; stakeholder-specific reporting; exception-based alerting system
thresholds.T1: Basic automated reporting with templates; standard dashboards; conventional disclosure mechanisms with ML enhancements; reasonable audit trails; simple data visualization

categories.name: Risk Assessment
categories.description: Evaluation of AI in RWA risk assessment and mitigation strategies

metrics.name: Credit Risk
metrics.description: Quality of AI-driven credit risk assessment for debt-based RWAs

thresholds.T0: Advanced AI credit models with alternative data integration; behavioral analysis for early default prediction; multi-factor credit scoring; dynamic risk adjustment based on market conditions; granular risk segmentation; explainable credit decisions; continuous learning from default patterns
thresholds.T1: Basic ML-enhanced credit models; standard credit scoring with some alternative data; periodic risk reassessment; conventional segmentation with ML optimization; reasonable default prediction

metrics.name: Market Risk
metrics.description: Effectiveness of AI-powered market risk assessment for RWAs

thresholds.T0: Sophisticated AI market risk models accounting for traditional and crypto market correlations; extreme event simulation; tail risk analysis; cross-asset contagion modeling; multi-timeframe VaR calculations; liquidity-adjusted risk metrics; scenario-based stress testing with ML parameter optimization
thresholds.T1: Basic AI-enhanced market risk assessment; standard VaR calculations; conventional stress testing with some ML components; reasonable correlation analysis; periodic scenario updates

metrics.name: Operational Risk
metrics.description: Quality of AI-driven operational risk assessment and mitigation

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive AI operational risk framework covering smart contract, custody, oracle, and counterparty risks; automated vulnerability scanning; continuous security monitoring; predictive incident modeling; scenario-based impact assessment; risk-aware contract design; multi-layered defense strategies
thresholds.T1: Basic AI-enhanced operational risk assessment; standard vulnerability checks; periodic security reviews; conventional incident response with ML assistance; reasonable impact assessment
